analysis.summary: Vue.js single file component that renders a ‘filter’ SVG icon with a configurable fill color and an (unused) order property.
analysis.purpose: Provides a reusable vector graphic (icon) for filtering controls in the navigation or toolbar of the application UI.

components.name: IconFilter
responsibilities: Renders an SVG path representing a filter icon
Exposes a fill color prop for theming

functions.name: defineProps
functions.purpose: Declares component props in the <script setup> context

fill.description: Color used to fill the SVG path

order.description: Declared but not used in the template; potentially for future directional control

analysis.usage:
Import the component and place it in a parent template. Example:

<script setup>
import IconFilter from 'modules/icons/navigation/IconFilter.vue'
</script>

<template>
  <IconFilter fill="#FF0000" />
</template>
notes: The `order` prop is defined but not currently referenced in the template or logic.
No CSS or scoped styles are present; the icon styling relies on the fill prop and global CSS variables.
Accessibility enhancements (role="img", aria-label) may be considered for screen readers.
Fixed width/height (48x48) and viewBox ensure consistent sizing across the UI.
